content:
Hi everyone.
I am currently starting with fsh and have gofsh-ed my project. As there were problems, I am currently debugging.
Except for external profiles from the German base profiles I got rid of nearly all errors. One open issue is the following
error: Cannot assign http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/observation-category to this element; a different uri is already assigned: "http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-category".

My instance looks like this: 

Instance: ExampleNutritionStatus
InstanceOf: NutritionStatus
Usage: #example
* meta.profile = "http://hs-osnabrueck.de/fhir/eWundbericht/StructureDefinition/NutritionStatus"
* status = #final
* category = $observation-category#exam
* code = $loinc#75305-3
* subject = Reference(ExamplePatient)
* effectiveDateTime = "2021-06-16"
* valueCodeableConcept = $snomedct#248324001 "Well nourished"

with 

Alias: $observation-category = http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/observation-category

in an "Alias"-File which is successfully included.
I am a little confused, as I thought, that I should give SUSHI the CodeSystem, not the ValueSet.
Can someone please help me getting rid of this error (I have it several times...)
Thanks in advance to all of you providing guidance or ideas.
you have defined fixed values on the category (including the fixed system to: http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/observation-category)
just fix your profile, and the example should work

oups, one should not set system to a valueset.
@Patrick Werner Thanks! Could you ballot for the eWoundSummary and mark this as a major revision?
